newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Zaire's ousted Mobutu arrives in Morocco.
newsitem.headline: Zaire's ousted Mobutu arrives in Morocco.

text.p: Zaire's ousted president Mobutu Sese Seko arrived in Morocco on Friday from Lome on board the presidential jet of Togolese leader Gnassingbe Eyadema, an airport official said.
Mobutu, who is stricken by cancer, was supported by aides as he walked slowly to a black limousine after disembarking from the Boeing 707.
The official said Mobutu was accompanied by members of his family. He gave no other details.
Reporters were barred from approaching the airport.
Mobutu and his entourage left the airport in a motorcade of a dozen cars along a route lined by security forces bound for the seaside resort of Skhirat
"Mobutu and his family will stay in principle at the Amphitrite hotel at the seaside," the official added.
A cancer clinc was recently opened in Rabat where the ailing president could be treated, a medical source said.
With 30 rooms, the three-star Amphitrite hotel is 20 km (12 miles) south of Rabat on an Atlantic beach next door to a palace used by King Hassan in summer.
The hotel was surrounded by security forces who barred reporters.
A staunch friend of King Hassan, Mobutu visited Morocco last February.
The official MAP news agency said in a brief statement: "President Mobutu had asked permission to spend a few days in Morocco for health reasons before going to his permanent place of residence."
Sources close to Togo President Eyadema said Mobutu would go on to France, where he has a Riviera villa, after the French elections which end on June 1.
Mobutu arrived in Lome from his jungle palace at Gbadolite in northern Zaire on Sunday night, a day after Laurent Kabila's rebels marched into Kinshasa.
He initially landed in Togo for a technical stopover but Togolese sources said the government had reluctantly agreed to let him stay longer because of his state of health.
